Author: gcharang#6833
Content:
In the KMD ecosystem, as a general rule,
Source code (Blockchain): C, C++
GUI: javascript
quick proof of Concept, scripts: Python

there are efforts to create modules in languages other than C

Author: ComputerGenie 👴🏼📢#7004
Content:
`This course is the first in the specialization Introduction to Programming in C, but its lessons extend to any language you might want to learn.`

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: It's easy, it is simple, it is the most important starting point.

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: if the starting is good, you'll never face the kind of hurdles you might face without fundamentals clearer.

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: once the basics are clear, with C, just start exploring any other languages, including JavaScript, HTML, CSS, Python.

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: See which one you like

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: by the time you ends your fundamentals lessons with C, it'd be pretty clear which kind of programming you want to do

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: just go with that choice and excel in that

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: and don't leave C behind. You'll regret leaving it.

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @grewalsatinder i have Unix Network Programming in hardcover from the 90's, it is considered the bible of unix network coding in C

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: if you want to write low level network applications in TCP/UDP and use raw sockets and understand select() and poll() and friends, that is the book.

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: (also nice to see Camelia, the Perl 6 mascot, as that github user avatar. Notice that each wing is a "P" and a "6")

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: I worked on Perl 6 stuff for a long time and wrote large chunks of the the test suite and virtual machine it used originally

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @jl777c this Sapling ZIP is very interesting, there will be a new transaction format v5 that disables sprout outputs at the transaction level: https://github.com/zcash/zips/blob/357c23f4ee380a1c350f6c94b1d5a31dd15d29ba/drafts/zip-daira-disable-sprout-outputs.rst

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content:
```
The removal of ephemeralKey and encCiphertexts fields means that for JoinSplit descriptions in v5 transactions, it is not necessary for a wallet to perform trial decryption of those fields to detect incoming payments as described in [4] sections 4.18 and 4.16.2. The processing of nullifiers in the algorithm of section 4.18 is unaffected.
```

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content:
and ```
Removing the ephemeralKey and encCiphertexts fields reduces the size of a JoinSplit description in a v5 transaction from 1698 bytes to 464 bytes, and avoids the need to scan those fields for incoming payments.
```

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: JoinSplits being 25% of the size, and greatly improving incoming payment wallet algo seem pretty interesting, but I am not sure what this means for KMD, since we disabled Sprout in a different way

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: "Shielded Coinbase" ZIP is pretty interesting as well: https://github.com/zcash/zips/blob/845ca0f8113bc73c42deb809cad3976d8cb7baa9/drafts/zip-str4d-shielded-coinbase.rst
